intro: Psychotria ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white to greenish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in the understory of tropical rainforests. The plant is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
